alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:15AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: Showers and thunderstorms continue across portions of the northern slopes of the Alaska Range. Radar estimates over the last 24 hours indicate that an additional 0.5 to 1.0 with localized amounts of up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in the northern slopes of the Alaska Range. This rain will cause rises along streams and rivers feeding the Tanana River. Therefore, expect higher river flows, flooding of low lying areas as well as debris. Most gravel bars on the Tanana River will be covered by water, and some normally dry sloughs and other low lying areas will fill with water. We are expecting more showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening near the Alaska Range which will continue the risk of flooding along streams and creeks in the region.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley
